Phuthaditjhaba is a [[Sotho language|seSotho]] name that means ''meeting place of the tribes''. It is located on the banks of the [[Elands River (Wilge)|Elands River]].<ref>[http://www.routes.co.za/fs/phuthaditjhaba/index.html Free State - Phuthaditjhaba]</ref> ==History== The frequent snow on the [[Drakensberg]] mountain peaks surrounding the town led the [[Bushmen|San]] to call the region Qwa-Qwa ''(whiter than white)''. It was known as ''Witsieshoek'' to the [[Europe]]an settlers, after Oetse, also Witsie and Wetsi, a [[Makholoko]] chief who lived there from 1839 to 1856.<ref name=dsapn>{{cite web|title=Dictionary of Southern African Place Names (Public Domain)|url=http://archive.org/details/DictionaryOfSouthernAfricanPlaceNames|publisher=Human Science Research Council|page=478}}</ref> The area was then developed into the [[bantustan]] or homeland of [[QwaQwa]] with Phuthaditjhaba as its capital. Since the apartheid system was abolished in South Africa in 1994 Phuthaditjhaba has become a vibrant town in the Eastern Free State. It boasts a well functioning regional hospital called Mofumahadi Manapo Mopeli Regional Hospital ==See also== *[[QwaQwa]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Populated places in the Thabo Mofutsanyane District Municipality]] {{FreeState-geo-stub}}
